results.title: Cheryl and Kevin
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Cheryl and Kevin are a young couple who have married before either was ready for the experience. Depicts and provokes thought about one of the major social problems to emerge from modern society and the changing values of young people.

results.title: Elementary experiments in the chemistry of water
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following elementary experiments which illustrate the chemistry of water. 1. Exploding one part of oxygen with two parts of hydrogen to form water. 2. Passing an electric current through pure water and salt solution. 3. Burning hydrogen to form water vapour. 4. Electrolysis of water.

results.title: Chemical conquest
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film report on how chemical research is on the side of the farmer in battle against the plagues that threaten his crops. Insects, plant diseases and weeds come under close scrutiny as scientists develop new formulas to check the invasions to which field and garden crops are subject. The film shows laboratory experiments at a government research station and examines the questions that still need to be answered about the ultimate effects of toxic substances on food-producing soil. Narrated by James Tapp.

results.title: Chelsea Football Club
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Behind the scenes and on the field with the Chelsea Football Club. The men and methods behind the organization of this well-known club are pictured, and the training required for players in both the main and reserve teams is described. Ends with an exciting Saturday afternoon league game.

results.title: The Charter of the United Nations
results.creator_credit: Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: An explanation of the structure and the purposes of the United Nations Organization, showing the General Assembly, the Security Council, and the various commissions set up to further the cause of world peace and well-being. Commentary by Francis Williams.

results.title: The Charter
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: The Charter and the main organs of the United Nations. Traces the historical background to the Charter, the broad principles laid down in its preamble and shows scenes of the meeting at which it was signed. Describes the membership and functions of the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council, the Trusteeship Council, the International Court of Justice and the United Nations Secretariat. Beautifully photographed and interspersed with newsreels and stock footage of both world wars. Compiled by V.R. Sarma; commentary by Alistair Cooke and Michael Allinson.

results.title: Charmes de l'existence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Gremillon, Pierre Kast and Films De Saint-Germain-Des-Pres
results.brief_description: French language only. The French Academy is the supreme arbiter of what is often referred to as “official art”, art that paints a surface reality but is in fact the embodiment of those morals, ideas and virtues that have received official sanction. In this film official art has been used to satire the social history of France at the turn of the century - the fashions, foibles, conventions, the glory of battle and triumph of virtue. Utilising canvases of painters who won the Prix de Rome between 1860 to 1914, the film follows the Seven Ages of Man, presenting the official view of a way of life. Award: International Prize for a Short Feature, Venice Film Festival, 1950.

results.title: Charlie's day
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A warning, though in comic style, that pure oxygen is a hazard, and a serious one, when handled without care in hospitals and elsewhere. Charlie, a hospital orderly, creates havoc just in moving a cylinder from storeroom to bedside. The film demonstrates how oxygen makes substances more combustible, even so unlikely a material as steel wool. A film for staff training wherever oxygen is used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Channel country
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The West Queensland cattle country. This film shows the plains of South-western Queensland and the intricate network of water courses, which during the wet season flood and provide irrigation for rich natural pastures, on which large herds of cattle are fattened for marketing; but which also brings the mail, freight, news and gossip to the outlying homesteads.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Changing wheat belt
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the wheat farmers of the West during the 1960’s and the changes their life and work are undergoing. Farms are larger but need fewer men. The drift is to the city where new industries develop, but wheat still dominates western life.
